p: Moreover, GÃ³mez-Estaca et al. [ 173] studied the effects of different EOs (including thyme) against 18 bacterial strains in fish muscle extract and concluded that clove oil was the best antimicrobial; the second best was rosemary, followed by thyme and lavender oils. These essential oils were able to inhibit Pseudomonas fluorescens and Pseudomonas aeruginosa; however, in accord with these results, Huang et al. [ 174] showed that thyme EO was not able to inhibit Pseudomonas spp.
